thread.title: Fighter jets take to the skies to train for Super Bowl
thread.title_full: Fighter jets take to the skies to train for Super Bowl

author: St. John Barned-Smith, Houston Chronicle
title: Fighter jets take to the skies to train for Super Bowl
text:
By St. John Barned-Smith  32   
The Air National Guard took to the skies Wednesday from Ellington Field Joint Reserve Base in a training exercise in advance of the Super Bowl. 
Among the security measures being enacted during the Super Bowl is a no-fly zone around NRG Stadium. 
Pilots aboard two F-16 Fighting Falcons participated in "Falcon Virgo," a training mission imagining if an errant pilot violated the no-fly zone. Photo: Mark Mulligan, Houston Chronicle Image 1 of / 4 Close Image 1 of 4 U.S. Air Force Staff Sgt. Nick Moore, with the 186th Air Refueling Wing, operates the boom on the back of a KC-135 Stratotanker while refueling an F-16 from the 138th Fighter Wing over the Gulf of Mexico, Wednesday, Feb. 1, 2017, in Houston. less U.S. Air Force Staff Sgt. Nick Moore, with the 186th Air Refueling Wing, operates the boom on the back of a KC-135 Stratotanker while refueling an F-16 from the 138th Fighter Wing over the Gulf of Mexico, ... more Photo: Mark Mulligan, Houston Chronicle Image 2 of 4 U.S. Air Force Staff Sgt. Nick Moore, with the 186th Air Refueling Wing, operates the boom on the back of a KC-135 Stratotanker while refueling an F-16 from the 138th Fighter Wing over the Gulf of Mexico, Wednesday, Feb. 1, 2017, in Houston. less U.S. Air Force Staff Sgt. Nick Moore, with the 186th Air Refueling Wing, operates the boom on the back of a KC-135 Stratotanker while refueling an F-16 from the 138th Fighter Wing over the Gulf of Mexico, ... more Photo: Mark Mulligan, Houston Chronicle Fighter jets take to the skies to train for Super Bowl 1 / 4 Back to Gallery 
The exercise allowed pilots to work on coordination with the numerous other agencies providing security for the Super Bowl, said Air National Guard Lt. Col. Ernie Mayfield. 
Afterwards, the pilots refueled with a KC-135R Stratotanker above the Gulf Coast. 
Take a look at the accompanying video to see the fighters make a high-velocity docking with the tanker.
